revised_title: Arthur Willey: A Pioneering Zoologist and His Quest for Nautilus Embryology
tldr: Arthur Willey was a prominent zoologist who conducted extensive research on the embryology of the Nautilus. Despite facing numerous challenges and setbacks during his expeditions to the East Indies and New Guinea, Willey's determination and passion for zoology led him to make valuable contributions to the field. His work on Nautilus, Ctenoplana, and other species, as well as his books on convergence in evolution and Darwinism, established him as a respected figure in the scientific community.
